knowledge.content:
Arguments
-effort effort_level Effort level in optimization, default is low.

-summarize_internal_iteration Summarize each internal iteration.

Description
The option -effort controls the count of internal optimization iterations. The pins will be sorted by the contributions on violations and classified into groups with different priorities. The higher effort level, the more groups will be classified. As a cost, more CPU time will be consumed in the optimization process. Generally, it will result in a better optimization quality with higher effort. However, this depends on the timing status, placement and routing density of the design. Sometimes, the last iteration will be inefficient, and waste a lot of die area. The option -summarize_internal_iteration can be turned on to review the effect of each internal iteration.

The following example fixes setup path violations with effort high.

% fix_setup_path_violations -effort high

% fix_setup_path_violations [get_paths -delay_type max \n                            -lower_bound -1.000 -upper_bound 0.000]       

The following example fixes setup path violations using remove_buffer methods.

% fix_setup_path_violations -remove_buffer_only       

The following example fixes setup path violations using size_cell only.

% fix_setup_path_violations -methods "size_cell"       

The following example fixes setup path violations using size_cell only and candidates area ratio is constrained to 3.0.

The following example fixes setup path violations using both size_cell and split_net.

% set_parameter eco_setup_slack_target 0.005
% set_parameter eco_hold_slack_margin -0.005
% fix_setup_path_violations -setup_target 0 -hold_margin -0.01

knowledge.content:
Arguments
-buffer_list buffer_inverter_names Buffers/Inverters used to fix SI violation for split_net, use buffers/

inverters defined in eco_buffer_list_for_setup if not specified.

-debug_pins pin_list XTop will print more debug log for specified pins, and abort fix once all these pins have been scanned.

-dff_only Only size dff (reg) cells when set. If not specified, only size comb cells. Can only work with size cell method and -on_clock option is unused.

-methods method_list Methods used to fix SI, can be any combination of size_cell and split_net, all enabled by default.

-size_rule rule_type Indicate the rule used to find candidates for sizing cells, use eco_cell_classify_rule if not specified.

Description
This command fixes SI violations in design. It will try to size cell, or split net, and choose the best one solution between them. By default, it only fixes violations on data paths. Once the fix process finished, it will report the solution number, area increased, and statistics of fail reason if violations are not fully fixed.

This command returns the number of solutions committed.

Arguments
violations The violations of pins to fix, all if not specified.

Description
This command also supports to fix specific violations by specifying a collection of violated pins. In XTop, the violations on the whole net is considered even only part of the sinks are specified. So, once a pin is specified, all the pins of the net will be taken into account. The timing summary and fail reason are also limited to pins on the nets.

When violated pins are specified by user, tool will automatically expand all the mirror pins of them.

The following example fix SI violations using size_cell for DFF only.

The following example fix SI violations using both split_net and size_cell on clock.

This command fixes transition violations in design.

Once the fix process finished, it will report the gain obtained, area and density variations. If the violations are not completely fixed, the statistics of fail reasons will also be reported. knowledge.content:
Arguments
-capacitance_margin margin_val Capacitance slack margin to be reserved with unit pF, use eco_capacitance_slack_margin if not specified.

-transition_margin margin_val Transition slack margin to be reserved with unit ns, use eco_transition_slack_margin if not specified.

-rel_transition_margin Relative transition slack margin to be reserved with rel_margin_val the value of percentage to max transition, use eco_relative_transition_slack_margin if not specified, a sum of transition_margin and rel_transition_margin will be actually used.

-transition_target slack_val Target of transition slack with unit ns, use eco_transition_slack_target if not specified.

Description
By default, this command will try to fix the violations to slack greater than 0, and will not break the max capacitance constraint, and max transition constraint of those nets that affected by this eco action indirectly. Commonly, this is enough since the algorithm is always a little pessimistic. However, if you really concerned about the effect and there are enough resources in the design, you can over-fix it by adding a positive target, and over-constraint the transition, capacitance by adding a positive margin with option -transition_target, -transition_margin and -capacitance_margin respectively.

If the target and margins are not specified, corresponding parameters eco_transition_slack_target, eco_transition_slack_margin, and eco_capacitance_slack_margin will be used as default.

knowledge.content:
Examples
The following example uses size cell and split net methods to fix transition violations.

% fix_transition_violations -methods {size_cell split_net}       

The following example fix transition violations only size DFF cells.

% fix_transition_violations -methods {size_cell} -dff_only       

The following example only fixes transition violations on clock path.

% fix_transition_violations -on_clock       

The following example over-fixes transition violations to 0.02ns.

% fix_transition_violations -transition_target 0.02       

The following example over-constraints the transition 0.01ns and capacitance by 0.01pF.

% fix_transition_violations -transition_margin 0.01 \n                            -capacitance_margin 0.01       

The following example uses nominal keywords defined in parameter eco_cell_nominal_sizing_pattern for sizing cells to fix transition violations.

% set_parameter eco_cell_nominal_sizing_pattern {X([0-9]+)TH}
% fix_transition_violations -size_rule nominal_regex \n                            -methods "size_cell"       

The following example only fixes transition violations of net connected topin U316/Z and U395/Z, and also check timing margin.

% fix_transition_violations {U316/Z U395/Z} -check_timing_margin

      

See Also fix_capacitance_violations fix_setup_path_violations fix_hold_path_violations

Commands

Name
fix_violations_by_clock_eco --Fix setup or hold violations by applying eco operations on clock.

Synopsis
fix_violations_by_clock_eco { -setup | -hold } -buffer buffer_name [-count num]
[-auto_scan] [-commit_separately] [-trace_level num] [-gain_ratio num] [-setup_wns_threshold
setup_wns_threshold] [-hold_wns_threshold hold_wns_threshold]

flag auto_scan

collection buffer

flag commit_separately

int count in "[1,10]"

int gain_ratio in "[1,inf)"

flag hold

float hold_wns_threshold

flag setup

float setup_wns_threshold

int trace_level in "[0,10]"

Arguments
-auto_scan Run in auto-scan mode to commit the optimal solutions within max

trace level and max buffer count.

-buffer buffer_name Clock buffer or inverter used to optimize violations.

-commit_separately Commit the solutions separately when update timing.

-count num Count of buffers or inverter pairs to form the basic unit of chain.
The default count is 1.

-gain_ratio num Minimum gain ratio to filter the solutions. The default gain ratio
is 1.

-hold Fix hold violations.

-hold_wns_threshold This threshold is to prevent Hold timing WNS from getting worse.
hold_wns_threshold

-setup Fix setup violations.

-setup_wns_threshold This threshold is to prevent Setup timing WNS from getting worse.
setup_wns_threshold

-trace_level num Maximum levels that allowed to trace back in analysis. The default
trace level is 5.

Description
This command fixes setup or hold violations by applying eco operations on clock. This command is a
combination of analysis and committing. Please refer to clock_eco_analysis and commit_clock_eco
for detail.

When option auto_scan specified, it will scan from 1 to max trace level and try delay from 1 to max buffer
count, commit the optimal solutions with the best total gain. It may take a long time, if the max trace level
and max buffer count are large.

Examples
The following example fixes hold violation by clock eco.

% fix_violations_by_clock_eco -buffer CKBUFF1 -hold
      

The following example fixes setup violation by clock eco and sets the basic unit buffer chain to 2.

% fix_violations_by_clock_eco -buffer CKBUFF1 -setup  -count 2
      

The following example fixes setup violation by clock eco and sets the maximum allowed trace level to 4.

% fix_violations_by_clock_eco -buffer CKBUFF1 -setup  -trace_level 4
      

The following example fixes setup violation by clock eco and sets gain ratio to 3 to filter solutions.

% fix_violations_by_clock_eco -buffer CKBUFF1 -setup -gain_ratio 3
      

The following example fixes hold violation by clock eco and sets gain ratio to 3 to filter solutions.
Moreover, auto scans optimal solutions within max trace level of 10 and max buffer count of 5.

% fix_violations_by_clock_eco -buffer CKBUFF1 -hold -trace_level 10 -count 5 -gain_ratio 3 -auto_scan
      

341

Commands

Name
fix_wire_length_violations --Fix wire length violations in design.

Synopsis
int fix_wire_length_violations [-buffer_list buffer_inverter_names] [-
max_wire_length threshold] [-on_clock] [-disable_report] [violations] [-debug_pins
pin_list]

collection buffer_list

collection debug_pins

flag disable_report

int max_wire_length in "[10,inf)"

flag on_clock

collection violations

Arguments
-buffer_list buffer_inverter_names Buffers/Inverters used to fix wire length violations, use buffers/

inverters defined in eco_buffer_list_for_setup if not specified.

-debug_pins pin_list XTop will print more debug log for specified pins, and abort fix
once all these pins have been scanned.

-disable_report Do NOT generate a report of violation and fail reason in workspace.

-max_wire_length threshold Max wire length threshold with unit um, use parameter
max_wire_length if not specified.

-on_clock Fix violations on clock only.

violations The violations of pins to fix, all if not specified.

Description
This command fixes wire length violations in design. It will try to split net, to keep wire length less than
the max wire length threshold defined by user. If this option is not set, it will use the value of parameter
max_wire_length. The unit of wire length is micro meter.

Once the fix process finished, it will report the solution number, area increased, and statistics of fail reason
if violations are not fully fixed.

By default, a report of violations and fail reasons is generated under the directory opt in workspace.
The maximum violation count is limited to 10000 since it will be time consuming if there are plenty of
violations remained. Option -disable_report can be used to avoid generating this report.

This command also supports to fix specific violations by specifying a collection of violated pins. The
summary and fail reason are also limited to specified pins. Here, the driver pin is used to represent a net
in order to interface with other commands.

When violated pins are specified by user, tool will automatically expand all the mirror pins of them.

This command returns the number of solutions committed.

Examples
The following example fix long wire violations.

% fix_wire_length_violations -max_wire_length 4096 -buffer_list {BUF01 BUF03}
      

The following example fix long wire violations on clock only.

% fix_wire_length_violations -buffer_list {BUF01 BUF0} -on_clock
      

The following example fix long wire violations on pin U384/ZN.

% fix_wire_length_violations {U384/ZN}
      

See Also
fix_fanout_violations

343

Commands

Name
get_failed_pins --Get pins of the specified fail reasons and ECO methods.

Synopsis
collection get_failed_pins [-methods method_list] -reasons reason_list

enum_list methods in "insert_buffer size_cell split_net remove_buffer"

string_list reasons

Arguments
-methods method_list The methods to check the fail reasons, all if not specified.

-reasons reason_list Wildcard patterns to match the fail reasons.

Description
This command gets pins of the specified fail reasons and ECO methods. In XTop, all the fail reasons are
marked on pins, though some reasons seem should be marked on cells and nets. To get the pins or nets,
use commands get_cells and get_nets with option -of_objects on the returned pin collection.

Notice that at the beginning of every optimization iterations, the marked reasons will be cleaned up, and
cannot be accumulated.

Examples
The following example gets all fail_to_legalize pins of all ECO methods and highlights them on layout.

% set fail_legal_pins [get_failed_pins -reasons fail_to_legalize]
"U105/ZN", "U110/ZN"
% highlight_objects $fail_legal_pins
      

The following example gets pins of fail reason dont_touch_pin of size_cell.

% get_failed_pins -reasons dont_touch_pin -methods size_cell
"U105/ZN"
      

344

Commands

Name
get_rank_pins --Create a collection of pins with given rank condition.

Synopsis
collection get_rank_pins [-by way_to_range] range

enum by in "rank order percentage"

string range

Arguments
-by way_to_range Specify the way that range represents.

range Set the range of rank value that used to return rank pin.

Description
This command create a collection of pins with given range, nothing will be returned if no rank marked
on pin.

Only the most recent rank type marked will be used. It is suggested to re-mark rank type if any eco action
committed.

Input pins will be returned if hold marked, otherwise, output pins are returned.

A correct range should be like {(lowLimit, highLimit)}. When range is defined by percentage, it should
between [0, 1.0]. When range is defined by order, the order index starts from 1.

Examples
The following example shows how to get rank pins of first 10%.

% get_rank_pins {(0,0.1)}
"clk_gen_u0/sync_u1/U1/Q", "clk_gen_u0/sync_u1/U0/Q", ...
      

The following example shows how to get rank pins of index number between 5 and 8.

% get_rank_pins -by order {(5,8)}
"sram_1_reg1/Q", "sram_2_reg1/Q", "sram_and_1/Z", "sram_1_reg2/Q"
      

The following example shows how to get rank pins that rank value between 3.0 and 3.1.

% get_rank_pins -by rank {(3.0,3.1)}
"alu/U129/ZN", "alu/U4/ZN", "alu/U127/ZN", ...
      
See Also
mark_hold_gba_pin_rank mark_setup_gba_pin_rank report_pin_rank summarize_pin_rank

346

Commands

Name
list_fail_reasons --List defined fail reasons that matched with specified pattern.

Synopsis
list_fail_reasons [-with_description] [patterns]

flag with_description

string_list patterns

Arguments
-with_description Print a short description of each matched fail reason.

patterns Wildcard patterns to match the fail reasons.

Description
This command lists defined fail reasons that matched with the specified pattern. If no pattern is specified,
all defined reasons will be listed. The pattern is matched by wildcard.

Examples
The following example lists all eco fail reasons in XTop.

% list_fail_reasons
      

The following example lists defined fail reasons with short description that matched with break_hold*.

% list_fail_reasons -with_description break_hold*
break_hold
  - Break hold while apply current solution.
break_hold_of_driver
  - Current solution breaks the hold of the driver cell.
      

347

Commands

Name
mark_area_pin_rank --Set pin's rank type for design area optimization.

Synopsis
mark_area_pin_rank -type rank_type [cells] [-pattern str]

string pattern

enum type in "area count margin congestion congestionReverse areaCount deltaAreaDelay"

collection cells

Arguments
-pattern str Pattern for sizing down cell, use eco_cell_nominal_sizing_pattern if not

specified, only needed when rank type is deltaAreaDelay.

-type rank_type Define rank type to calculate rank value for design area optimization.

cells Cells that will be considered, all if not specified.

Description
This command will define the criteria for calculating rank value of each pin, which is used to handle pin's
area optimization priority. So that when -effort option is not low, we can put all pins to different groups, for
a better optimization result. Basically, the default rank type is good enough for most cases, user can change
the rank type according to their need. Only output pins which are possible to optimize will be marked.

The option -type defines different rank type for calculating pin's rank. We now offer following type for
the command:

--area: pin's library cell area.

--count: it is the sum of non-violated endpoint's weight, that in the downstream of current pin, where the
weight of each endpoint is set to 1.0, higher priority if the pin has less impact to those endpoints.

--margin: pin's setup margin, higher priority for better margin.

--congestion: pin's congestion ratio.

--congestionReverse: reversed order of congestion.

--areaCount: pin's area rank, divided by count rank.

--deltaAreaDelay: cell sizing down pattern must be available before mark this rank type, and assume
swapping original cell to last candidate, rank is calculated using delta of liberty cell area, divided by
corresponding delta of liberty delay.

When option cells specified, only output pins of cells will be considered. If need to optimize these cells,
they should also be added to optimize command.

When the command is not explicitly called by user, default rank type is count. Otherwise, the marked rank
type is used. In both cases, the command will always be called automatically in optimize area process,
if effort is not low.

Old pin rank will be cleared when the command is called.

We guarantee that pin with larger rank value always has higher priority. So for some rank type, rank value
will be the opposite number of its original one.

Examples
The following example set rank type to setup margin, and pin with a better setup margin will have higher
priority.

% mark_area_pin_rank -type margin
      

See Also
mark_leakage_pin_rank

349

Commands

Name
mark_dynamic_pin_rank --Set pin's rank type for dynamic power optimization.

Synopsis
mark_dynamic_pin_rank -type rank_type [cells]

enum type in "dynamic count margin congestion congestionReverse"

collection cells

Arguments
-type rank_type Define rank type to calculate rank value for dynamic power optimization.

cells Cells that will be considered, all if not specified.

Description
This command will define the criteria for calculating rank value of each pin, which is used to handle pin's
dynamic optimization priority. So that when -effort option is not low, we can put all pins to different groups,
for a better optimization result. Basically, the default rank type is good enough for most cases, user can
change the type according to their need. Only output pins which are possible to optimize will be marked.

The option -type defines different rank type for calculating pin's rank. We now offer following type for
the command:

--dynamic: pin's library cell dynamic power.

--count: it is the sum of non-violated endpoint's weight, that in the downstream of current pin, where the
weight of each endpoint is set to 1.0, higher priority if the pin has less impact to those endpoints.

--margin: pin's setup margin, higher priority for better margin.

--congestion: pin's congestion ratio.

--congestionReverse: reversed order of congestion.

When option cells specified, only output pins of cells will be considered. If need to optimize these cells,
they should also be added to optimize command.

When the command is not explicitly called by user, default rank type is count. Otherwise, the marked
rank type is used. In both cases, the command will always be called automatically in optimize dynamic
process, if the effort is not low.

Old pin rank will be cleared when the command is called.

We guarantee that pin with larger rank value always has higher priority. So for some rank type, rank value
will be the opposite number of its original one.

Examples
The following example set rank type to congestion, and optimize dynamic power.

% mark_dynamic_pin_rank -type congestion
% optimize_dynamic_power -effort high
      

See Also
mark_leakage_pin_rank mark_area_pin_rank

351

Commands

Name
mark_hold_gba_pin_rank --Set pin's rank type for hold gba fix.

Synopsis
mark_hold_gba_pin_rank -type rank_type [pins]

enum type in "count countSlack slack si siReverse margin congestion congestionReverse"

collection pins

Arguments
-type rank_type Define rank type to calculate rank value for hold gba fix.

pins Pins that will be marked, all if not specified.

Description
This command will define the criteria for calculating rank value of each pin, which is used to handle pin's
hold fix priority. So that when -effort option is not low, we can put all pins to different groups, for a better
optimization result. Basically, the default rank type is good enough for most cases, user can change the
rank type according to their need. Only input pins with violation will be marked in this command.

The option -type defines different rank type for calculating pin's rank. We now offer following type for
the command:

--count: it is the sum of violated endpoint's weight, that in the downstream of current pin, where the weight
of each endpoint is set to 1.0, higher priority if the pin is more significant to fix those violations.

--countSlack: same as count, but setting violated weight to endpoint's slack instead of 1.0.

--si: pin's SI value.

--siReverse: reversed order of si.

--margin: pin's setup margin, higher priority for better margin.

--slack: pin's hold slack, start from the worst one.

--congestion: pin's congestion ratio.

--congestionReverse: reversed order of congestion.

When option pins specified, all fanin and fanout will be traced. If need to fix only these pins, they should
also be added to fix command.

When the command is not explicitly called by user, default rank type is count. Otherwise, the marked rank
type is used. In both cases, the command will always be called automatically in fix hold gba process, if
effort is not low.

Old pin rank will be cleared when the command is called.

We guarantee that pin with larger rank value always has higher priority. So for some rank type, rank value
will be adjusted to the opposite number of its original one.

Examples
The following example set rank type to congestion for hold gba fix.

% mark_hold_gba_pin_rank -type congestion
      

See Also
mark_hold_path_pin_rank

353

Commands

Name
mark_hold_path_pin_rank --Set pin's rank type for hold path fix.

Synopsis
mark_hold_path_pin_rank -type rank_type [paths]

enum type in "count countSlack si siReverse margin congestion congestionReverse"

collection paths

Arguments
-type rank_type Define rank type to calculate rank value for hold path fix.

paths Paths that will be included, all if not specified.

Description
This command will define the criteria for calculating rank value of each pin, which is used to handle pin's
hold fix priority. So that when -effort option is not low, we can put all pins on paths to different groups,
for a better optimization result. Basically, the default rank type is good enough for most cases, user can
change the rank type according to their need. Only input pins on path will be marked in this command.

The option -type defines different rank type for calculating pin's rank. We now offer following type for
the command:

--count: path number through this pin.

--countSlack: accumulated path slack of all paths through this pin.

--si: pin's SI value.

--siReverse: reversed order of si.

--margin: pin's setup margin, higher priority for better margin.

--congestion: pin's congestion ratio.

--congestionReverse: reversed order of congestion.

When option paths specified, only pins on these paths will be marked. These paths should also be added
to fix command if only need to fix them.

When the command is not explicitly called by user, default rank type is count. Otherwise, the marked rank
type is used. In both cases, the command will always be called automatically in fix hold path process, if
effort is not low.

Old pin rank will be cleared when the command is called.

We guarantee that pin with larger rank value always has higher priority. So for some rank type, rank value
will be adjusted to the opposite number of its original one.

Examples
The following example set rank type to count for hold path fix.
% mark_hold_path_pin_rank -type count
      
See Also
mark_hold_gba_pin_rank

355

Commands

Name
mark_leakage_pin_rank --Set pin's rank type for leakage power optimization.

Synopsis
mark_leakage_pin_rank -type rank_type [cells] [-keywords name_list]

string_list keywords

enum type in "leakage count margin congestion congestionReverse leakageCount deltaLeakageDelay"

collection cells

Arguments
-keywords name_list Keywords for swapping cells, use eco_cell_nominal_swap_keywords if

not specified, only needed when rank type is deltaLeakageDelay.

-type rank_type Define rank type to calculate rank value for leakage power optimization.

cells Cells that will be considered, all if not specified.

Description
This command will define the criteria for calculating rank value of each pin, which is used to handle
pin's leakage optimization priority. So that when -effort option is not low, we can put all pins to different
groups, for a better optimization result. Basically, the default rank type is good enough for most cases,
user can change the rank type according to their need. Only output pins which are possible to optimize
will be marked.

The option -type defines different rank type for calculating pin's rank. We now offer following type for
the command:

--leakage: pin's library cell leakage power.

--count: it is the sum of non-violated endpoint's weight, that in the downstream of current pin, where the
weight of each endpoint is set to 1.0, higher priority if the pin has less impact to those endpoints.

--margin: pin's setup margin, higher priority for better margin.

--congestion: pin's congestion ratio.

--congestionReverse: reversed order of congestion.

--leakageCount: pin's leakage rank, divided by count rank.

--deltaLeakageDelay: cell swapping keywords must be available before mark this rank type, and assume
swapping original cell to last candidate, rank is calculated using delta of liberty leakage power, divided
by corresponding delta of liberty delay.

When option cells specified, only output pins of cells will be considered. If need to optimize these cells,
they should also be added to optimize command.

When the command is not explicitly called by user, default rank type is count. Otherwise, the marked rank
type is used. In both cases, the command will always be called automatically in optimize leakage process,
if effort is not low.

Old pin rank will be cleared when the command is called.

We guarantee that pin with larger rank value always has higher priority. So for some rank type, rank value
will be the opposite number of its original one.

Examples
The following example set rank type to deltaLeakageDelay, and optimize using preset swap keywords.

% set_parameter eco_cell_nominal_swap_keywords {"LVT" "" "HVT"}
% mark_leakage_pin_rank -type deltaLeakageDelay
% optimize_leakage_power -effort high
      

See Also
mark_area_pin_rank

357

Name
mark_setup_gba_pin_rank --Set pin's rank type for setup gba fix.

Synopsis
mark_setup_gba_pin_rank -type rank_type [pins]

enum type in "count countSlack countDelay slack si siReverse margin congestion congestionReverse
transition fanout wireLength"

collection pins

Arguments
-type rank_type Define rank type to calculate rank value for setup gba fix.

pins Pins that will be marked, all if not specified.

Description
This command will define the criteria for calculating rank value of each pin, which is used to handle pin's
setup fix priority. So that when -effort option is not low, we can put all pins to different groups, for a better
optimization result. Basically, the default rank type is good enough for most cases, user can change the
rank type according to their need. Only output pins with violation will be marked in this command.

The option -type defines different rank type for calculating pin's rank. We now offer following type for
the command:

--count: it is the sum of violated endpoint's weight, that in the downstream of current pin, where the weight
of each endpoint is set to 1.0, higher priority if the pin is more significant to fix those violations.

--countSlack: same as count rank, but setting violated weight to endpoint's slack instead of 1.0.

--countDelay: using count rank, and multiplying corresponding pin's liberty cell delay.

--si: pin's SI value.

--siReverse: reversed order of si.

--margin: pin's hold margin, higher priority for better margin.

--congestionReverse: reversed order of congestion.

--transition: pin's transition.

--fanout: pin's fanout number.

rank type is used. In both cases, the command will always be called automatically in fix setup gba process,
if effort is not low.

Old pin rank will be cleared when the command is called.

We guarantee that pin with larger rank value always has higher priority. So for some rank type, rank value
will be adjusted to the opposite number of its original one.

Examples

priority.

fanout wireLength"

Commands

Name
narrow_timing_margins --Narrow the timing margin, only for GBA mode.

Synopsis
narrow_timing_margins [ -setup | -hold ] [-scenarios patterns] factor

flag hold

string_list scenarios

flag setup

float factor in "(0.1,10)"

Arguments
-hold Narrow hold margins.

-scenarios patterns Scenarios to narrow the margins, matched by wildcard.

-setup Narrow setup margins.

factor The factor to multiply with positive slack.

Description
This command narrows the timing margin, only for GBA mode. It will multiply the positive slack with the
specified factor. If no hold or setup flag specified, both setup and hold margins will be narrowed. Margins
of all scenarios will be modified unless scenarios are specified.

Here the word "narrow" acts just like "scale" except that it gives a hint that you should narrow the margin
for most cases if the margins broken a lot. However, it is not prohibited to specify a factor more than 1.0
to enlarge the timing margin if you really want to do that.

Examples
The following example specifies a factor to narrow the setup timing violations.

% narrow_timing_margins -setup 0.95
      

362

knowledge.summary:
Commands

Name
optimize_design_area --Optimize design area of the design.

Synopsis
int optimize_design_area [ -remove_buffer_only | -pattern str ] [- dff_only] [-hold_margin margin_val] [-setup_margin margin_val] [-transition_margin margin_val] [-rel_transition_margin rel_margin_val] [-capacitance_margin margin_val] [- effort effort_level] [-summarize_internal_iteration] [ -only_pins pin_list | cells ] [- debug_pins pin_list]

float capacitance_margin

collection debug_pins

flag dff_only

enum effort in "low medium high ultra_high extreme_high"

float hold_margin

collection only_pins

string pattern

float rel_transition_margin in "[0,0.5]"

flag remove_buffer_only

float setup_margin

flag summarize_internal_iteration

float transition_margin

collection cells
knowledge.content:
Arguments
-capacitance_margin margin_val Capacitance slack margin to be reserved with unit pF, use

eco_capacitance_slack_margin if not specified.

-debug_pins pin_list XTop will print more debug log for specified pins, and abort fix once all these pins have been scanned.

-dff_only Only size down dff cells when set. If not specified, only size down comb cells.

-hold_margin margin_val Hold slack margin to be reserved with unit ns, use eco_hold_slack_margin if not specified.

-pattern str Pattern for sizing down cell, use eco_cell_nominal_sizing_pattern if not specified.

-rel_transition_margin Relative transition slack margin to be reserved with rel_margin_val the value of percentage to max transition, use

eco_relative_transition_slack_margin if not specified, a sum of transition_margin and rel_transition_margin will be actually used.

-remove_buffer_only Remove buffer only.

-setup_margin margin_val Setup slack margin to be reserved with unit ns, use eco_setup_slack_margin if not specified.

-transition_margin margin_val Transition slack margin to be reserved with unit ns, use eco_transition_slack_margin if not specified.

Description
This command optimizes area of the design by removing buffer or sizing down cells without introducing any timing and design rule violations. While sizing down, it finds the candidates according to the specified nominal sizing pattern.

This command returns the number of solutions committed. If you want to allow breaking setup after optimization, you can set the setup margin to a negative value.

knowledge.summary:
Commands

Name
optimize_design_area --Optimize design area of the design.

Synopsis
int optimize_design_area [ -remove_buffer_only | -pattern str ] [- dff_only] [-hold_margin margin_val] [-setup_margin margin_val] [-transition_margin margin_val] [-rel_transition_margin rel_margin_val] [-capacitance_margin margin_val] [- effort effort_level] [-summarize_internal_iteration] [ -only_pins pin_list | cells ] [- debug_pins pin_list]

float capacitance_margin

collection debug_pins

flag dff_only

enum effort in "low medium high ultra_high extreme_high"

float hold_margin

collection only_pins

string pattern

float rel_transition_margin in "[0,0.5]"

flag remove_buffer_only

float setup_margin

flag summarize_internal_iteration

float transition_margin

collection cells
knowledge.content:
Arguments
-effort effort_level Effort level in optimization, default is low.

-summarize_internal_iteration Summarize each internal iteration.

Description
The option -effort controls the count of internal optimization iterations. The pins will be sorted by a factor of cost and classified into groups with different priorities. The higher effort level, the more groups will be classified. As a cost, more CPU time will be consumed in the optimization process. Generally, it will result in a better optimization quality with higher effort. However, this depends on the timing status, placement and routing density of the design. Sometimes, the last iteration will be inefficient. The option -summarize_internal_iteration can be turned on to review the effect of each internal iteration.

knowledge.summary:
Commands

Name
optimize_design_area --Optimize design area of the design.

Synopsis
int optimize_design_area [ -remove_buffer_only | -pattern str ] [- dff_only] [-hold_margin margin_val] [-setup_margin margin_val] [-transition_margin margin_val] [-rel_transition_margin rel_margin_val] [-capacitance_margin margin_val] [- effort effort_level] [-summarize_internal_iteration] [ -only_pins pin_list | cells ] [- debug_pins pin_list]

float capacitance_margin

collection debug_pins

flag dff_only

enum effort in "low medium high ultra_high extreme_high"

float hold_margin

collection only_pins

string pattern

float rel_transition_margin in "[0,0.5]"

flag remove_buffer_only

float setup_margin

flag summarize_internal_iteration

float transition_margin

collection cells
knowledge.content:
Arguments
-only_pins pin_list Only generate solutions on specified pins if not empty.

cells Cells to size, all if not specified.

Description
If you only want to size specific cells, just specify the cell collection in this command. For example, to only size cells in a specified region on layout by specifying cells with command get_cells_in_region. Option -only_pins is the original way for this purpose by specifying specific pins, it is obsoleted now, and is kept here only for compatibility. All the mirror cells of these specified cells will also be considered.

knowledge.summary:
Commands

Name
optimize_design_area --Optimize design area of the design.

Synopsis
int optimize_design_area [ -remove_buffer_only | -pattern str ] [- dff_only] [-hold_margin margin_val] [-setup_margin margin_val] [-transition_margin margin_val] [-rel_transition_margin rel_margin_val] [-capacitance_margin margin_val] [- effort effort_level] [-summarize_internal_iteration] [ -only_pins pin_list | cells ] [- debug_pins pin_list]

float capacitance_margin

collection debug_pins

flag dff_only

enum effort in "low medium high ultra_high extreme_high"

float hold_margin

collection only_pins

string pattern

float rel_transition_margin in "[0,0.5]"

flag remove_buffer_only

float setup_margin

flag summarize_internal_iteration

float transition_margin

collection cells
knowledge.content:
Examples
The following example optimizes design area by remove_buffer method only.

% optimize_design_area -remove_buffer_only       

The following example optimizes design area by sizing cells down honoring following regular expression rule.

% set_parameter eco_cell_nominal_sizing_pattern {X([0-9]+)TH}
% optimize_design_area       

If no eco_cell_nominal_sizing_pattern specified, user can define sizing pattern in this command too.

% optimize_design_area -pattern {X([0-9]+)TH}       

The following example optimizes design area with setup_margin 0.01ns and transition margin 0.05ns

% set_parameter eco_cell_nominal_sizing_pattern {X([0-9]+)TH}
% optimize_design_area -setup_margin 0.01 -transition_margin 0.05       

Optimize area and only size cells in a specified region.

% optimize_design_area [get_cells_in_region -rect "((0.0, 0.0)(11.0, 95.0))"]

Commands

Name
optimize_dynamic_power --Optimize dynamic power of the design.

Synopsis
int optimize_dynamic_power [-size_rule rule_type] [-hold_margin margin_val]
[-setup_margin margin_val] [-transition_margin margin_val] [-rel_transition_margin
rel_margin_val] [-capacitance_margin margin_val] [-effort effort_level] [-
summarize_internal_iteration] [ -dff_only | -enable_multithread ] [ -only_pins pin_list | cells ] [-
debug_pins pin_list]

float capacitance_margin

collection debug_pins

flag dff_only

enum effort in "low medium high ultra_high extreme_high"

flag enable_multithread

float hold_margin

collection only_pins

float rel_transition_margin in "[0,0.5]"

float setup_margin

enum size_rule in "cell_attribute nominal_keywords nominal_regex"

flag summarize_internal_iteration

float transition_margin

collection cells

Arguments
-capacitance_margin margin_val Capacitance slack margin to be reserved with unit pF, use

eco_capacitance_slack_margin if not specified.

-debug_pins pin_list XTop will print more debug log for specified pins, and abort fix
once all these pins have been scanned.

-dff_only Only size dff (reg) cells when set. If not specified, tool only swap comb cells at data path.

-effort effort_level Effort level in optimization, default is low.

-enable_multithread Enable multi-thread sizing comb cells. This function is disabled
when use debug_pins or pin list.

-hold_margin margin_val Hold slack margin to be reserved with unit ns, use
eco_hold_slack_margin if not specified.

-only_pins pin_list Only generate solutions on specified pins if specified.

-rel_transition_margin Relative transition slack margin to be reserved with
rel_margin_val the value of percentage to max transition, use

eco_relative_transition_slack_margin if not specified, a sum of
transition_margin and rel_transition_margin will be actually used.

-setup_margin margin_val Setup slack margin to be reserved with unit ns, use
eco_setup_slack_margin if not specified.

-size_rule rule_type Indicate the rule used to find candidates for sizing cells, use
eco_cell_classify_rule if not specified.

-summarize_internal_iteration Summarize each internal iteration.

-transition_margin margin_val Transition slack margin to be reserved with unit ns, use
eco_transition_slack_margin if not specified.

cells Cells to optimize, all if not specified.

Description
This command optimizes the dynamic power of the design by sizing down cells. Dynamic power is
calculated by switching power and internal power for each cell on reference scenario. If toggle rate file is
not linked, toggle rate value used in optimization will be eco parameter "eco_power_toggle_rate". If rail
voltage file is not linked, rail voltage value used in optimization will be from corresponding timing lib file.

When sizing rule is set to nominal_keywords, only matched cell after current keywords will be considered,
similar to leakage optimization.

This command returns the number of solutions committed.

Examples
The following example optimizes dynamic power by sizing cells, and uses cell_attribute as sizing rule.

% set_parameter eco_cell_classify_rule cell_attribute
% optimize_dynamic_power
      

The following example optimizes dynamic power by sizing cells, and swap VT by nominal keywords.

% set_parameter eco_cell_nominal_swap_keywords {"ULVT" "LVT" "" "HVT"}
% optimize_dynamic_power -size_rule nominal_keywords
      

See Also
optimize_leakage_power

367

knowledge.summary:
Commands

Name
optimize_leakage_power --Optimize leakage power of the design.

Synopsis
int optimize_leakage_power [-keywords name_list] [-hold_margin margin_val] [-setup_margin margin_val] [-transition_margin margin_val] [-rel_transition_margin rel_margin_val] [-capacitance_margin margin_val] [-effort effort_level] [-group] [- summarize_internal_iteration] [{ -dff_only | -enable_multithread } [-swap_vt_only]] [-auto_iteration iteration_number] [ -only_pins pin_list | cells ] [-debug_pins pin_list]

int auto_iteration in "[1,20]"

float capacitance_margin

collection debug_pins

flag dff_only

enum effort in "low medium high ultra_high extreme_high"

flag enable_multithread

flag group

float hold_margin

string_list keywords

collection only_pins

float rel_transition_margin in "[0,0.5]"

float setup_margin

flag summarize_internal_iteration

flag swap_vt_only

float transition_margin

collection cells
knowledge.content:
Arguments
-capacitance_margin margin_val Capacitance slack margin to be reserved with unit pF, use eco_capacitance_slack_margin if not specified.

-debug_pins pin_list XTop will print more debug log for specified pins, and abort fix once all these pins have been scanned.

-dff_only Only swap dff cells when set. If not specified, tool only swap comb cells at data path.

-enable_multithread Enable multi-thread swap cells for comb cells. This function is disabled when use debug_pins or pin list.

-group If group target pins according to interconnection and take pins in proportion for each iteration.

-hold_margin margin_val Hold slack margin to be reserved with unit ns, use eco_hold_slack_margin if not specified.

-rel_transition_margin Relative transition slack margin to be reserved with rel_margin_val the value of percentage to max transition, use

eco_relative_transition_slack_margin if not specified, a sum of transition_margin and rel_transition_margin will be actually used.

-setup_margin margin_val Setup slack margin to be reserved with unit ns, use eco_setup_slack_margin if not specified.

-swap_vt_only When multi-thread is enabled, this can be specified to if user only swap VT, and legal margin is {0 0}, to speedup legalization.

-transition_margin margin_val Transition slack margin to be reserved with unit ns, use eco_transition_slack_margin if not specified.

Description
This command optimizes the leakage power of the design by swapping cells with the specified keywords. The keywords must be specified in order such that corresponding cells are with descending leakage power.

For those libraries with multiple dimensions of keywords, it is recommended to optimize several times with only one dimension in each iteration. However, if you does know how to sort keywords with multiple dimension, you can also specify a multiple dimension keyword list with "@" as the separator.

This command returns the number of solutions committed. If you want to allow breaking setup after optimization, you can set the setup margin to a negative value.

collection cells
knowledge.content:
Arguments
-effort effort_level Effort level in optimization, default is low.

-summarize_internal_iteration Summarize each internal iteration.

Description
The option -effort controls the count of internal optimization iterations. The pins will be sorted by a factor of cost and classified into groups with different priorities. The higher effort level, the more groups will be classified. As a cost, more CPU time will be consumed in the optimization process. Generally, it will result in a better optimization quality with higher effort. However, this depends on the timing status, placement and routing density of the design. Sometimes, the last iteration will be inefficient. The option -summarize_internal_iteration can be turned on to review the effect of each internal iteration.

knowledge.content:
Arguments
-only_pins pin_list Only generate solutions on specified pins if specified.

cells Cells to swap, all if not specified.

Description
If you only want to swap specific cells, just specify the cell collection in this command. For example, to only swap cells in a specified region on layout by specifying cells with command get_cells_in_region. Option -only_pins is the original way for this purpose by specifying specific pins, it is obsoleted now, and is kept here only for compatibility. All the mirror cells of these specified cells will also be considered.

knowledge.content:
Arguments
-auto_iteration iteration_number Automatically optimize leakage power several times with keywords divided by analyze_leakage_keywords. At least 3 keywords are needed if using this feature. By default, no iteration.

Description
XTop now support automatically iteration by option -auto_iteration if many swap keywords are given. Keywords will be divided into groups according to analyze_leakage_keywords. If iteration number is equal or more than keywords number - 1, it is bubble mode. It will run many times if many keywords are given under this mode.

optimize_leakage_power --Optimize leakage power of the design.

Synopsis
int optimize_leakage_power [-keywords name_list] [-hold_margin margin_val] [-setup_margin margin_val] [-transition_margin margin_val] [-rel_transition_margin rel_margin_val] [-capacitance_margin margin_val] [-effort effort_level] [-group] [- summarize_internal_iteration] [{ -dff_only | -enable_multithread } [-swap_vt_only]] [-auto_iteration iteration_number] [ -only_pins pin_list | cells ] [-debug_pins pin_list]

flag summarize_internal_iteration

flag swap_vt_only

float transition_margin

collection cells
knowledge.content:
Examples
The following example optimizes leakage power by sizing cells honoring following keywords rule.

% set_parameter eco_cell_nominal_swap_keywords \n                {"ULVT" "LVT" "" "HVT"}
% optimize_leakage_power       

If no eco_cell_nominal_swap_keywords specified, user can define keywords in this command too.

% optimize_leakage_power -keywords {"ULVT" "LVT" "" "HVT"}       

The following example optimizes leakage power with setup_margin 0.01ns and transition margin 0.05ns.

% set_parameter eco_cell_nominal_swap_keywords    \n                {"ULVT" "LVT" "" "HVT"}
% optimize_leakage_power -setup_margin 0.01      \n                         -transition_margin 0.05       

Optimize leakages and only swapping cells in a specified region.

% optimize_leakage_power [get_cells_in_region -rect "((0.0, 0.0)(11.0, 95.0))"]       

The following example optimize leakage power several times automatically, by using -auto_iteration option.

% optimize_leakage_power -keywords {"10ULVT" "10LVT" "20ULVT" "20LVT"} -auto_iteration 3

Description
This command refines gba timing data by path slack value to improve timing data accuracy. Then delete
all timing path for more efficient timing optimization.

knowledge.summary:
Commands

Name
report_fail_reasons --Report fail reason on pins of the optimization process.

Synopsis
report_fail_reasons [-methods method_list] [{ -disable_timing | -stats } [-exclude_reasons reason_list] [-verbose]] [-truncate num] { -pins pin_list | -paths path_list }

flag disable_timing

string_list exclude_reasons

enum_list methods in "insert_buffer size_cell split_net remove_buffer"

collection paths

collection pins

flag stats

int truncate

flag verbose
knowledge.content:
Arguments
-disable_timing Not to output the timing information.

-exclude_reasons reason_list Reasons not to report in statistical summary, matched by wildcard.

-methods method_list The methods to report fail reason, all if not specified.

-stats Report statistical of fail reasons.

-truncate num Count limitation of the number of pins or paths to report, default is 100, zero or negative value means all.

-verbose Report the pins for each fail reason.

Description
This command reports fail reason on pins of the optimization process. If the violation on pin can not be fixed, commonly a reason will be marked for each tried method. If the pin has been fixed successfully, or has no violation at all, it will be marked with "-".

Since it can only mark one reason for one method of each pin, it can only report the reason of the last tried candidate. For example, if ten alternative cells tried for one cell and all failed, only the reason of the last one can be reported. It is possible that no reason is marked, if the pin has solution but not completely fixed, or the violation is caused by fix process.

knowledge.summary:
Commands

Name
report_fail_reasons --Report fail reason on pins of the optimization process.

Synopsis
report_fail_reasons [-methods method_list] [{ -disable_timing | -stats } [-exclude_reasons reason_list] [-verbose]] [-truncate num] { -pins pin_list | -paths path_list }

flag disable_timing

string_list exclude_reasons

enum_list methods in "insert_buffer size_cell split_net remove_buffer"

collection paths

collection pins

flag stats

int truncate

flag verbose
knowledge.content:
Arguments
-paths path_list Paths to report.

-pins pin_list Pins to report.

Description
For the -pins and -paths, if pin or path are specified by names directly, it will get the corresponding objects in background silently and will not report information if not found. So, if you are not sure about the names, it is recommended to get the collection with corresponding command first instead of specifying names directly.

knowledge.summary:
Commands

Name
report_fail_reasons --Report fail reason on pins of the optimization process.

Synopsis
report_fail_reasons [-methods method_list] [{ -disable_timing | -stats } [-exclude_reasons reason_list] [-verbose]] [-truncate num] { -pins pin_list | -paths path_list }

flag disable_timing

string_list exclude_reasons

enum_list methods in "insert_buffer size_cell split_net remove_buffer"

collection paths

collection pins

flag stats

int truncate

flag verbose
knowledge.content:
Examples
The following example reports statistical of fail reasons of pins.

% report_fail_reasons -pins * -stats Reason                                                   Count   
% ------------------------------------------------------------------- break_setup_of_driver  ################################    49 79.0% break_setup            #####...........................     7 11.3% break_max_capacitance  ####............................     6  9.7%       

The following example reports statistical of fail reasons of pins and the pins for each fail reason.

% report_fail_reasons -pins * -stats -verbose Reason                                                   Count   
% ------------------------------------------------------------------- break_setup_of_driver  ################################    49 79.0% break_setup            #####...........................     7 11.3% break_max_capacitance  ####............................     6  9.7% (@) break_setup_of_driver : 49 Name     S_Slack  H_Slack  S_Trans  Max_Trans  S_Cap  Max_Cap  ... ------------------------------------------------------------------ U47/B2    -5.715   -1.524    0.516      0.320      *        *      U56/A2    -6.561   -1.997    0.296      0.320      *        *     ... (@) break_setup : 7 Name     S_Slack  H_Slack  S_Trans  Max_Trans  S_Cap  Max_Cap  ... ------------------------------------------------------------------ U454/B1    0.298   -2.580    0.083      0.320      *        *     U460/B1    0.390   -1.852    0.083      0.320      *        *     ... (@) break_max_capacitance : 6 Name              S_Slack  H_Slack  S_Trans  Max_Trans  S_Cap  ... ------------------------------------------------------------------ option_reg_0_/D     6.565   -2.139    0.819      0.320      *     option_reg_1_/D     5.381   -2.527    0.809      0.320      *    ...       

The following example reports fail reasons of the first 2 pins.

% report_fail_reasons -pins * -truncate 2 Pin                Master     Insert Buffer    Size Cell    ... --------------------------------------------------------------- stack1_reg_2_/CP   DFFD1EP    -                -            - stack1_reg_2_/D    DFFD1EP    -                -            -        The following example reports fail reasons of the first 5 paths.

% report_fail_reasons -paths * -truncate 5 path: Path_0 Pin                Master      Insert Buffer    Size Cell    ... ---------------------------------------------------------------- pc_reg_8_/CP       DFFD1EP     -                -            - pc_reg_8_/QN       DFFD1EP     -                -            - ... U386/A2            AND2D1EP    break_setup      -            - U386/ZN            AND2D1EP    -                -            - stack1_reg_8_/D    DFFD4EP     break_setup      -            - -                  -           -                -            - ...       

The following example reports fail reasons for method size cell of pins without timing information.

% report_fail_reasons -methods size_cell -pins * -disable_timing Pin                 Master       Size Cell ------------------------------------------------------- stack1_reg_5_/Q     DFFD1EP      sequential_cell inst_1__U2/A1       AND2D1EP     - inst_1__U2/A2       AND2D1EP     - inst_1__U2/Z        AND2D1EP     break_max_capacitance ...

Commands

Name
report_pin_rank --Report rank value for given pin.

Synopsis
report_pin_rank pin [-effort effort_level] [-group]

enum effort in "low medium high ultra_high extreme_high"

flag group

collection pin

Arguments
-effort effort_level Effort level in optimization, default is low. The iteration number will be

reported according to effort level after ranking.

-group If group pins according to interconnection and take pins in proportion for
each iteration. The reported index will be the pin index in group.

pin Pin to report.

Description
This command will return rank value for given pin.

Pin will not be reported if no rank type is marked, or pin direction mismatch, or no need to be fixed.

Only the most recent rank type marked will be reported. If any eco action is committed after rank marked,
a dirty flag will be found in report, indicating the rank data is not reliable. It is suggested to re-mark rank
type manually if need to report the value after fix.

Examples
The following example shows how to report rank value.

% report_pin_rank stacklevel_reg_1_/Q
Index    Iteration    Name                  Rank
-------------------------------------------------
1025     1            stacklevel_reg_1_/Q   1.8963e-07
      

See Also
mark_hold_gba_pin_rank mark_setup_gba_pin_rank summarize_pin_rank

375

Commands

Name
summarize_buffers --Summarize major properties of buffers or inverters.

Synopsis
summarize_buffers buffer_list

collection buffer_list

Arguments
buffer_list Buffers to summarize.

Description
This command summarizes major properties of buffers or inverters. It will list the worst typical max and
min delay, which scenario the delay belongs to, area, leakage power of them. In case the scenario has a
very long name, it will give scenario id. Then find the scenario full name through "get_scenario -by_id"
command. Please refer to get_scenario for details. Those cells that not exist in all corners will be skipped.

Examples
The following example summarizes the buffers matching given pattern.

% summarize_buffers [get_lib_cells */BUFFD*]
Index    Name            Max Delay    Max Sce    Min Delay    Min Sce     Ratio       Area      Leakage
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    0    BUFFD0EPLVT        0.0680          2       0.0311          0    2.1850     1.9200      33.4369
    1    BUFFD24EP          0.0639          2       0.0288          0    2.2165    20.1600      40.2960
    2    BUFFD3EPLVT        0.0512          2       0.0234          0    2.1837     3.3600     148.2235
    3    BUFFD6EPHVT        0.0970          2       0.0385          0    2.5176     5.7600       0.5322
...
      

376

Commands

Name
summarize_pin_rank --Summarize pins rank type, value, and other status.

Synopsis
summarize_pin_rank [pins] [-with_top_n count]

int with_top_n in "[1,inf)"

collection pins

Arguments
-with_top_n count Also report the top n pins.

pins Pins to summarize.

Description
This command will print a summary for given pin's rank information, all pins area included if pins is not
specified.

While -with_top_n is specified, it will display the information of top n pins.

Pin will not be reported if no rank type is marked, or pin direction not match, or no need to be fixed.

Only the most recent rank type marked will be summarized. If any eco action is committed after rank
marked, a dirty flag will be found in summary, indicating the rank data is not reliable. It is suggested to
re-mark rank type manually if need to summarize after fix.

Examples
The following example shows how to summarize current pin rank.

% summarize_pin_rank
### rank summary ###
Rank type: margin   Opt target: leakage
Min rank: 1.9818   Max rank: 5.8801
Total rank pin: 4061
### rank distribution ###
Range                                                      Count        %
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
1.98 ~ 2.37    ##################......................     1782    43.9%
2.37 ~ 2.76    ############............................     1199    29.5%
2.76 ~ 3.15    ##......................................      238     5.9%
...
      

See Also
mark_hold_gba_pin_rank mark_setup_gba_pin_rank report_pin_rank

knowledge.summary:
Commands

Name
write_incremental_sdf --Write incremental sdf file, which cleans all hold violations, and tries to clean setup violations as well.

Synopsis
int write_incremental_sdf -dir dir_name [-prefix prefix_name] { -hold | { -setup [-reserved_cell_delay_percentage reserved_delay_percentage]}} [-target target_val] [-anno_derate derate_val] [-both_timing_type]

float anno_derate in "[0.5,2]"

flag both_timing_type

string dir

flag hold

string prefix

float reserved_cell_delay_percentage in "[0.2,1]"

flag setup

float target in "[0,100)"
knowledge.content:
Arguments
-hold Write incremental sdf file for hold violations, file name will append with "_hold".

-setup Write incremental sdf file for setup violations, file name will append with "_setup".

-dir dir_name Specify the directory to save sdf file, file will be saved for every scenario.

-prefix prefix_name File name prefix, use "xtop_" if not specified.

-reserved_cell_delay_percentage Cell arc delay percentage that will be reserved when decreasing cell reserved_delay_percentage delay for setup, if a larger value is set, less slack is to be fixed.

Default is 0.5.

-target target_val Target of hold or setup slack when writing incremental sdf, unit is ns. Uses 0 if not specified, parameter eco_hold_slack_target and eco_setup_slack_target are not considered. It is suggested to set an extra target for hold in order to be cleaned.

Description
This command will write incremental sdf file. All hold violations can be cleaned, and setup violations will also be tried to fix. The files will be saved to the directory given by -dir for all scenarios, and named begin with -prefix, and scenario names.

knowledge.summary:
Commands

Name
write_incremental_sdf --Write incremental sdf file, which cleans all hold violations, and tries to clean setup violations as well.

Synopsis
int write_incremental_sdf -dir dir_name [-prefix prefix_name] { -hold | { -setup [-reserved_cell_delay_percentage reserved_delay_percentage]}} [-target target_val] [- anno_derate derate_val] [-both_timing_type]

float anno_derate in "[0.5,2]"

flag both_timing_type

string dir

flag hold

string prefix

float reserved_cell_delay_percentage in "[0.2,1]"

flag setup

float target in "[0,100)"
knowledge.content:
Arguments
-anno_derate derate_val Derate value for sdf, for adjustment purpose, default 1.0.

Description
-anno_derate is an options to adjust incremental delay in sdf file, in most cases, it would be fine to just keep it default value.

knowledge.summary:
Commands

Name
write_incremental_sdf --Write incremental sdf file, which cleans all hold violations, and tries to clean setup violations as well.

Synopsis
int write_incremental_sdf -dir dir_name [-prefix prefix_name] { -hold | { -setup [-reserved_cell_delay_percentage reserved_delay_percentage]}} [-target target_val] [- anno_derate derate_val] [-both_timing_type]

float anno_derate in "[0.5,2]"

flag both_timing_type

string dir

flag hold

string prefix

float reserved_cell_delay_percentage in "[0.2,1]"

flag setup

float target in "[0,100)"
knowledge.content:
Arguments
-both_timing_type Affect both sdf_min and sdf_max when write file.

Description
By default, when fix hold, only sdf_min will be affected, when fix setup, only sdf_max will be affected. -both_timing_type can be specified to apply the delay change to both. In this case, XTop will also consider both type, it is suggested to run hold fix in the last step and set a fix target to keep hold clean.

knowledge.summary:
Commands

Name
write_incremental_sdf --Write incremental sdf file, which cleans all hold violations, and tries to clean setup violations as well.

Synopsis
int write_incremental_sdf -dir dir_name [-prefix prefix_name] { -hold | { -setup [-reserved_cell_delay_percentage reserved_delay_percentage]}} [-target target_val] [- anno_derate derate_val] [-both_timing_type]

float anno_derate in "[0.5,2]"

flag both_timing_type

string dir

flag hold

string prefix

float reserved_cell_delay_percentage in "[0.2,1]"

flag setup

float target in "[0,100)"
knowledge.content:
Description
While fixing, gba data is considered, so not recommended to include pba data, and can save more time. If only write sdf file, and no other fix will be done, -ignore_data_for_sdf can be specified during read_timing_data, so only gba slack will be read, in this case, cell delay is calculated using FO4. At the same time, logical only mode can also be used to save run time and memory usage.

Slack will be annotated after this command executed, so use it carefully with other fix or optimize command.

knowledge.summary:
Commands

Name
write_incremental_sdf --Write incremental sdf file, which cleans all hold violations, and tries to clean setup violations as well.

Synopsis
int write_incremental_sdf -dir dir_name [-prefix prefix_name] { -hold | { -setup [-reserved_cell_delay_percentage reserved_delay_percentage]}} [-target target_val] [- anno_derate derate_val] [-both_timing_type]

float anno_derate in "[0.5,2]"

flag both_timing_type

string dir

flag hold

string prefix

float reserved_cell_delay_percentage in "[0.2,1]"

flag setup

float target in "[0,100)"
knowledge.content:
Examples
The following example write an incremental sdf file for hold, set its fix target.

% write_incremental_sdf -dir dir_to_save -hold -target 0.02       

The following example write an incremental sdf file for setup, and set prefix.

% write_incremental_sdf -dir dir_to_save -setup \
                        -reserved_cell_delay_percentage 0.6 -prefix mysdf_       

The following example read only global slack file, and write an incremental sdf file for hold and setup.
% read_timing_data -data_dir sta_data -ignore_data_for_sdf
% write_incremental_sdf -dir dir_to_save -setup
% write_incremental_sdf -dir dir_to_save -hold -target 0.03       

See Also fix_hold_gba_violations fix_setup_gba_violations

Parameters

Name
cell_capacitance_corner --Specify the corner used to calculate capacitance in cell trend analysis.

Type
type: string

Default
default = ""

Description
In cell trend analysis, some time user want to check cell's different attribute in different corner. This
parameter specifies the corner to calculate cell's delay and transition. If user want to analyze cell in mixed
corners, you MUST specified this parameter and several other parameters: cell_delay_transition_corner
cell_internal_power_corner cell_leakage_power_corner If anyone of these parameters has not been
specified, or anyone of the specified corners is not exist in the same session,cell trend analysis only analyze
cell's all attributes in same corner.

Examples
See Also

cell_delay_transition_corner cell_internal_power_corner cell_leakage_power_corner

381

Parameters

Name
cell_delay_transition_corner --Specify the corner used to calculate delay/transition in cell trend analysis.

Type
type: string

Default
default = ""

Description
In cell trend analysis, some time user want to check cell's different attribute in different corner. This
parameter specifies the corner to calculate cell's delay and transition. If user want to analyze cell in mixed
corners, you MUST specified this parameter and several other parameters: cell_internal_power_corner
cell_leakage_power_corner cell_capacitance_corner If anyone of these parameters has not been
specified, or anyone of the specified corners is not exist in the same session, cell trend analysis only analyze
cell's all attributes in same corner.

Examples
See Also

cell_internal_power_corner cell_leakage_power_corner cell_capacitance_corner

382

Parameters

Name
cell_internal_power_corner --Specify the corner used to calculate internal power in cell trend analysis.

Type
type: string

Default
default = ""

Description
In cell trend analysis, some time user want to check cell's different attribute in different corner. This
parameter specifies the corner to calculate cell's delay and transition. If user want to analyze cell in mixed
corners, you MUST specified this parameter and several other parameters: cell_delay_transition_corner
cell_leakage_power_corner cell_capacitance_corner If anyone of these parameters has not been
specified, or anyone of the specified corners is not exist in the same session, cell trend analysis only analyze
cell's all attributes in same corner.

Examples

type: enum "setup_only hold_only setup_hold_both setup_hold_window"

Description
This parameter specifies the method to calculate a cell's constraint. XTop provides four typical sample
methods.

--setup_only. Only the rise/fall constraint in setup_rising/falling will be calculated.

--hold_only. Only the rise/fall constraint in hold_rising/falling will be calculated.

--setup_hold_both. All the rise/fall constraint in setup/hold rising/falling will be calculated.

--setup_hold_window. Rise constraint in setup/hold rising/falling will be summed up based on
condition; Fall constraint in setup/hold_rising/falling will be summed up based on condition.
The calculated values will be selected based on the tmlib_edge_evaluation_principle and the
tmlib_arc_evaluation_principle and the tmlib_cell_evaluation_principle.

409

Parameters

Name
tmlib_memory_cell_delay_arc --Specify the method to evaluate memory cell's delay.

Type
type: enum "read_arc write_arc clock_cycle"

Default
default = "clock_cycle"

Description
The parameter specifies the method to evaluate memory cell's delay.

Usually, there are three types of delay for memory: read/write/cycle. For rom memory which is read-only,
there is no write delay. The tool provides three methods for users to evaluate memory delay:

--read_arc: the read arc delay is divided into two phases: the first phase is the setup time of address pin
to its related clock pin; the second phase is the delay from clock pin to outpin pin. The summation of
two phases is the read delay.

--write_arc: the write arc delay is defined as setup/hold window of the address pins and data input pins.
For rom memory has no write arc, its write delay is always 0.0.

--clock_cycles: the clock cycle is defined on the clock pin. It can be defined by minimum_period, or by
attribute min_period. When duplicate cycle info is defined in library, the data will be taken with above
order.

Examples

      % set_parameter tmlib_memory_cell_delay_arc {read_arc}
      

See Also
tmlib_memory_cell_evaluation_unit

410

Parameters

Name
tmlib_memory_cell_evaluation_unit --Specify the evaluation unit for memory cell's area, leakage power
and internal power.

Type
type: enum "cell word byte bit"

Default
default = "cell"

Description
This parameter specifies the evaluation unit for memory cell. It is applied in the evaluation of memory's
area,leakage power and internal power.

In the timing library, data of area and leakage power are measured for the whole cell. Besides the concept
of cell, users might evaluate memory with concepts of word, byte, bit, such as area of cell, area of each
word, area of each byte, area of each bit. The valid evaluation_unit includes:

--cell

--word

--byte

--bit

For example, a memory with address_width 7, word_width 64, represents 1 cell, 128 words, 128*64/8
bytes, 128*64 bits. The evaluation is based on the value looked up from the timing library and the number
of evaluation_unit.

Internal power on standard cell is defined on output pins and some input pins. It describes the internal
power when the output or input pin switches. For memory library, besides the internal power on bit level,
all relevant internal power at each switching are usually aggregated to clock pin, which means, the internal
power defined on clock pin describes the whole cell's internal power. Therefore, only the internal power
groups on clock pin are token into evaluation. Since the switching happens at one word each time, one
word's internal power equals to the whole cell's internal power.

Examples
      
      % set_parameter tmlib_memory_cell_evaluation_unit {word}
      

See Also
tmlib_memory_cell_delay_arc

411

Parameters

Name
tmlib_rect_average_rect --Specify the sub-table rectangle for rect_average method.

Type
type: rect

Default
default = "((0,0) (8,8))"

Description
This parameter specifies the sub-table rectangle for rect_average method. The parameter can be defined
by :

--((x1, y1) (x2, y2)): specifies left-top and right-bottom of the rectangle.

--(x1, y1, width, height): specifies left-top and width/height of the rectangle. With this format, (right,
bottom) = (left+width-1, top+height-1).

For a 2-D table with size (M, N), its x-axis index range is [0, M-1], y-axis index range is [0, N-1]. The
average points are overlaps between rectangles ((0,0) (M-1, N-1)) and ((x1, y1) (x2, y2)). For example,
original table is 7x7, user rectangle is ((1,1) (3,3)), then the average points are {(1,1), (1,2), (1,3), (2,1),
(2,2), (2,3), (3,1), (3,2), (3,3)}.

For a 1-D table, y* is ignored. The average points are overlaps between (0, M-1) and (x1, x2). For example,
original table is 7x1, user rectangle is ((1,1) (3,3)), then the average points are {(1,0), (2,0), (3,0)}.

Tables with more than 3-D are skipped.

Examples

% set_parameter tmlib_table_sample_method {rect_average}  
% set_parameter tmlib_rect_average_rect {((1, 1) (4, 4))}  // format 1
% set_parameter tmlib_rect_average_rect {(1, 1, 4, 4)}     // format 2
      

See Also
tmlib_table_sample_method

412

Parameters

Name
tmlib_sequential_delay_definition --Specify the delay calculation method for sequential arcs.

Type
type: enum "data_delay constraint_window average_data_delay clock_delay"

Default
default = "data_delay"

Description
This parameter specifies the delay calculation method for sequential arcs.

Generally speaking, the sequential arcs from clock pin to data output are usually taken as delay arc, such
as ck->q; the sequential arcs from clock pin to data input are usually taken as constraint arc, such as ck-
>d. In timing evaluation, especially the delay evaluation, the sequential arc is considered as a combination
of delay arc and constraint arc to represent the cell characteristics on data propagation.

How to do the combination? First, find the delay arc on the sequential cell; Second, find the constraint arc
related to the clock pins on previous delay arc; Third, append the data input of the constraint arc to the
corresponding delay arc. So now, the arc with both constraint and delay info is generated.

With this parameter, the delay of the generated arc is calculated:

--data_delay : the minimal delay that is needed for data to output pin. It is defined as the sum of setup
constraint and the delay from clock pin to output pin.

--constraint_window : the minimal delay that a data input should keep steady. It is defined as the sum of
setup constraint and the corresponding hold constraint.

--average_dat_delay : It is defined as the average of data_delay and constraint_window.

--clock_delay : It is defined as only delay from CK to Q, not considered the constraint infos.

Currently the delay arc include the arcs with timing_type attribute in timing group as :

--rising_edge

--falling_edge

The constraint arc include the arcs with timing_type attribute in timing groups as :

--setup_rising

--setup_falling

--hold_rising

--hold_falling

Examples

    % set_parameter tmlib_sequential_delay_definition {constraint_window}
    

See Also
tmlib_latch_timing_arc_definition

Name
placement_legalization_mode --Specify whether to use placement legalization mode.

Type
type: bool

Default
default = "true"

Description
This parameter specifies whether to use placement legalization mode. While it is off, the changed cells
and the newly inserted cells will be placed just at the original and specified locations. Otherwise, it will try
to search legal places for these cells within the legalization distance, and squeeze other cells if possible.

This parameter has no effect for logical only mode and postmask eco.

The following example shows how to disable the on_legal mode.

424

Parameters

Name
placement_legalization_obligated --Placement legalization is obligated or not.

Type
type: bool

Default
default = "false"

Description
By default, parameter placement_legalization_obligated is set to false, and if the legalization failed, it will go on the action, and place these cells at the original or specified places. It needs extra efforts later to find legal places for these cells. While parameter placement_legalization_mode is set to true, it will try to legalize the sized, moved, or inserted cells in manual eco.
If you do not want commit an eco action while it failed to place it legally, just set parameter placement_legalization_obligated to true, it will report an error and do nothing.

For those actions that moves, sizes or inserts multiples cells, it will fail and do nothing if it fails to place anyone of them legally.

default = "false"

By default, heavy fanout net is not allowed to be touched during auto optimization. When this parameter
is set true, it is allowed to do eco actions on such net. But user should be sure that timing is not an issue.

This parameter is only effective for DRC fix for now.

426

Parameters

Name
eco_auto_setup_extra_derate --Allow auto set setup_extra_derate and pocvm_logic_depth_scale_factor.

Type
type: bool

Default
default = "false"

Description
When it is set to true, for hold fix, when the process is 5nm/7nm and voltage of corresponding corner
is less than 0.7v, set_setup_extra_derate will be automatically set to 1.05. If pocv enabled, when the process
is 5nm/7nm and there is one corner voltage less than 0.7v, pocvm_logic_depth_scale_factor will be
automatically set to 0.5.

When it is set to true, for leakage optimization, set_setup_extra_derate will be automatically set to 1.02.

Please note, when those two parameters are manually set by user, the automatic setting will be invalid.

Examples
The following example shows how to set the parameter:

% set_parameter eco_auto_setup_extra_derate false

eco_buffer_group --A macro buffer group for buffers with different types.

Description
This parameter defines a macro buffer group for buffers with different types. The foundry will provides
two major types of buffers: normal buffer and delay buffer. And commonly they are defined with different
footprint in libraries. If you want to swap buffers between normal and delay buffers, it needs to define
such a buffer group. While any member is defined in buffer group, the whole buffer group that classified
by eco_cell_match_attribute will also be added to this group.

The buffer names can be specified with wildcard, any cells matched the specified wildcard will be added
to this group. It will affect the result of report_matched_cells and report_cell_classification.

Examples
The following example classifies normal buffers and delay buffers into one group.
